title: Transportation 2
sentences: What time does the plane fly toward London?
lleva mucha carga por la carretera.
The truck carries a lot of cargo on the road.
el coche en un lugar seguro.
I need to park the car in a safe place.
Put on the seatbelt before leaving.
Where is the nearest gas station?
You have to turn at the next corner.
pasa por el centro de la ciudad.
The tram passes through the city center.
Watch out, the crosswalk is a bit far away.
My bicycle has a flat tire (wheel).
Lo siento, el tren tiene un
I'm sorry, the train has a twenty-minute delay.
What is my seat number on the bus?
You can't drive in that lane; it's for buses.
We have to check in the bags before the flight.
Si vas en moto, siempre usa el
If you go by motorcycle, always use the helmet.
el tren si no te das prisa.
Run! We are going to miss (lose) the train if you don't hurry.
hasta el final de la calle.
Keep going straight until the end of the street.
Walk on the sidewalk to be safer.
del coche hace un ruido extraño.
The car engine is making a strange noise.
el río por el puente viejo?
Do you want to cross the river via the old bridge?
He dejado el coche en el
I have left the car in the parking lot downtown.
Look at the map to see where we are now.
Do you have the hotel reservation made?
Turn to the right after the traffic light.
The museum is to the left of the cathedral.
The van is white and very large.
dictionary:
Volar - To fly
El camión - The truck
Aparcar - To park
El cinturón de seguridad - The seatbelt
La gasolinera - The gas station
Girar - To turn
El tranvía - The tram
El paso de cebra - The crosswalk
La rueda - The wheel/tire
El retraso - The delay
El asiento - The seat
El carril - The lane
Facturar - To check in (luggage)
El casco - The helmet
Perder - To lose/miss
Recto - Straight
La acera - The sidewalk
El motor - The engine
Cruzar - To cross
El parking - The parking lot
El mapa - The map
La reserva - The reservation
A la derecha - To the right
A la izquierda - To the left
La furgoneta - The van
